snippet: In the Affordable Care Act marketplaces so far, insurance filings show good news for the federal budget and aggressive shoppers. But people who don’t shop could get stuck with a big bill.
abstract: The Upshot; analysis of data from McKinsey Center for US Health System Reform shows that in many places premiums are going up by double-digit percentages within many of the most popular health plans under the Affordable Care Act, while others are being cut, making shopping around crucial.

byline.original: By MARGOT SANGER-KATZ and AMANDA COX

lead_paragraph: In the Affordable Care Act marketplaces so far, insurance filings show good news for the federal budget and aggressive shoppers. But people who don’t shop could get stuck with a big bill.

headline.print_headline: With New Health Law, Crucial Choices
headline.main: With New Health Law, Shopping Around Can Be Crucial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
